description: Ahead of this weekend's FA Cup action, Sportsmail will be providing you with all you need to know about every fixture, with team news, provisional squads, betting odds and Opta stats.
title: MK Dons vs Chelsea: Team news, kick-off time, probable line-ups, odds and stats for the FA Cup clash
title_page: MK Dons vs Chelsea: Team news, kick-off time, probable line-ups, odds and stats for the FA Cup clash  | Daily Mail Online
text:
Ahead of this weekend's FA Cup action, Sportsmail will be providing you with all you need to know about every fixture, with team news, provisional squads, betting odds and Opta stats. Here is all the information you need for Chelsea's trip to Championship side MK Dons.
Team news
MK Dons
Striker Nicky Maynard (hamstring) is a doubt, while Carl Baker (ankle), Matthew Upson (hamstring) and Ben Reeves (thigh) are all out.
George Baldock is cup-tied after returning from a loan spell at Oxford United.
Provisional squad: Martin, Hodson, Lewington, McFadzean, Kay, Potter, Bowditch, Church, Spence, Carruthers, Walsh, Powell, Baldock, Hitchcock, Rasulo, Jennings, Cropper, Williams, Tilney, Tshimanga, Maynard, Brittain, Murphy, Hall, Forster-Caskey
Matthew Upson will miss the clash with Chelsea in the FA Cup with a hamstring injury
Chelsea
Chelsea playmaker Eden Hazard could start for the first time in four weeks on Sunday.
Diego Costa is fit to feature despite suffering a knee problem in last week's Premier League win at Arsenal, but fellow striker Loic Remy (calf) is a doubt.
Striker Radamel Falcao (thigh) remains out and imminent deals for Alexandre Pato and Matt Miazga are unlikely to be completed in time for them to feature.
Provisional squad: Courtois, Begovic, Ivanovic, Fabregas, Zouma, Rahman, Oscar, Mikel, Traore, Kenedy, Pedro, Remy, Costa, Matic, Willian, Cahill, Terry, Azpilicueta, Amelia, Aina, Loftus-Cheek.
Chelsea playmaker Eden Hazard could start for the first time in four weeks on Sunday
Key match facts (supplied by Opta)
MK DONS v CHELSEA Kick-off: Sunday, 4pm (BBC One) Odds (subject to change): MK Dons: 21/2 Draw: 17/4 Chelsea: 4/11 Referee: Jonathan Moss Managers: Karl Robinson (MK Dons), Guus Hiddink (Chelsea
This will be the first meeting between these two sides in a competitive match.
Chelsea are appearing in the fourth round for the 18th consecutive season. However, they’ve been eliminated at this stage in two of the last five season, including a 4-2 defeat against League One Bradford last season.
MK Dons have won just one of their six home FA Cup games against a team from a higher division than themselves (2-0 vs Sheffield Wednesday in 2013).
However, the Dons won their last FA Cup game against Premier League opposition, beating QPR 4-2 at Loftus Road in a fourth round tie in 2013.
Chelsea are now unbeaten in their last eight competitive matches (W4 D4).
Diego Costa has scored six goals in six competitive appearances under Guus Hiddink – this after netting just four goals in 21 competitive games before the Dutchman took charge of the Blues this season.
iego Costa has scored six goals in six competitive appearances under Guus Hiddink
